page.title: 01Combwich and Surrounds.
page.content: At the heart of this area lies the village of Combwich,which is situated on the west bank of the River Parrett. The river widens and sweeps through a flood plain notable for wildlife,as it pushes towards Bridgwater bay.The river is tidal leaving mudflats at low tide and becoming a deep racing river at high tide. To the west of the village lie the Quantock Hills. Between them and the river are fertile farmlands and quarries of limestone sandstone.On the other side of the river,the pastures of Pawlett Hams provide good grazing for farm animals. Barely 3 miles from the village is nuclear power station,providing electricity for the south west and employment for some villagers.Others work in the light industries of Bridgwater Town.
